body: Ha, there must be a reason for that: `InterpreterState::pImpl` is of type `c10::intrusive_ptr<InterpreterStateImpl>`. `c10::intrusive_ptr` requires the full definition of its target (`InterpreterStateImpl`). So that's why I put most functions of `InterpreterStateImpl` private and leave its constructor public.
body_html: Ha, there must be a reason for that: InterpreterState::pImpl is of type c10::intrusive_ptr<InterpreterStateImpl>. c10::intrusive_ptr requires the full definition of its target (InterpreterStateImpl). So that's why I put most functions of InterpreterStateImpl private and leave its constructor public.
body_text: Ha, there must be a reason for that: InterpreterState::pImpl is of type c10::intrusive_ptr<InterpreterStateImpl>. c10::intrusive_ptr requires the full definition of its target (InterpreterStateImpl). So that's why I put most functions of InterpreterStateImpl private and leave its constructor public.
